body.p: As a desktop application does not store user sensitive data or user specific files on remote servers. The full Privacy Policy is available on the official web site.

Whenever it is started, the application may connect to its official web site (https://www.oxygenxml.com) in order to provide notifications about new releases or new events. In the Preferences Global page there are a number of checkboxes which can be used to disable if needed this type of connections:
Automatic Version Checking To obtain information about new available versions from the official web site the application provides the license category (academic/professional/enterprise), the product version, Java version and operating system name.
Check for Oxygen-related events at startup No specific information about the current installation is passed to the web site when the application obtains information about events which gets displayed in the Welcome screen.
Check for notifications No specific information about the current installation is passed to the web site when the application obtains information about other various notifications which get displayed.

Providing installation-specific details to the technical support team is also possible by using the main menu Help Report problem action. The Report problem dialog shows exactly the specific details which are sent to the technical support team.

When the application is installed on Windows or Linux using the provided installation kit the last installation step allows clicking a Privacy Options link in order to choose exactly what privacy-related settings should be disabled before the application starts for the first time.
